website_summaries.verdict: A set of cups available in sets of 2 or 4 that will retain heat longer than other models.
pros: We love how each package comes with a handwritten note from the company owner
The double-walled construction works as an effective insulator and users report stellar customer service
cons: Their delicate construction sometimes impacts the final product, resulting in flawed merchandise

customer_reviews.title: good espresso cups
customer_reviews.text: I've used Bodum insulated espresso cups for years. They've gradually diminished in numbers as thin glass cups are wont to do. I was delighted to find that Kitchables had a variety that was more cost-effective than Bodum, and every bit as good in performance. They're comfortable in the hand, the double wall makes them adequately heat resistant, and the quality is good. Nick at Kitchables is doing a good job in his marketing (though the website sorely needs the upgrade it is currently going through). Handwritten notes accompany purchases, and Kitchables tries to reach out to ensure their products have arrived and fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cane Questions

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my espresso warm!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They are great for keeping my espresso warm. I must admit though, I thought these would hold 2 shots. I’m sure they have larger ones and I will be ordering them ASAP. The packaging was really good. The box was inside an Amazon box. The box that contained the glasses was very sturdy and I don’t think me dropping the from 100 feet would have broken them. Thank you Nick, you will be seeing my next order soon.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Espresso lovers!
customer_reviews.text: These espresso cups are great! They keep your hand cool and the espresso hot, (other cups dissipate heat quickly leaving your espresso cold). Also very stylish and fit perfectly under my Nespresso machine. Getting a lot of comments in the office from visitors and coworkers. Everyone loves them. I will defiantly buy more for the house. Good product and good seller. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dwightisite

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive so I took a chance, great bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Honestly i felt like i was taking a chance on these since they're so inexpensive but it turned out well, really great bang for to buck. These feel pretty sturdy and work well for espresso. They are slightly large for restretto, I pull 28-30g shots and only fills just about half way. Double walled is ideal for two main reasons: thin glass means no need to warm up the cup and plus i can see the crema build as i pull the shot. I can't speak to durability as i dont drop things often but i never warm them up and they get hot espresso crema 1st thing in the mornings without any drama so i gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Great product and service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a replacement for a similar product that was broken in an accident. The price for the 4 pack was similar to a 2 pack of the glasses I had before. When I received them, one had a production flaw and quickly broke. I wasn't that concerned as even 3 were a good value for the price, and put two of these glasses into rotation. Without any prompting, I received a follow-up email from Kitchables customer service. When I told them about the flawed glass, they immediately sent two replacement glasses. I am super-satisfied with both Kitchables and their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: David Small

customer_reviews.title: Good espresso  glasses
customer_reviews.text: I bought these glasses to use with my breville 870 espresso machine and they work well, a little less than i would have liked though. Their shape makes them unable to be put super close together, so i have to position them perfectly to catch the coffee on the very sides. The actual construction of them feels nice, the heat retention seems to work well. I love the actual look of them, just wish they were slightly less bulbous so it would fit under the espresso spouts just a bit better, but it still works for its purpose and compared to other dual wall espresso glasses I have used they feel better in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M. Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Poor design

Another issues is pouring the espresso. The design of the cups causes the espresso to pour down the side of the cup no matter how fast you pour. Simply a terrible design. I gave two stars only due to the excellent packaging and shipping. The cups themselves deserve only one star.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Meh-customer service no response to issue

I emailed nick@kitchables as the card in the box mentioned if I had an issue, and it’s been a week with no response. For this and the price for customer service, I take off stars. I can purchase anywhere but I had chose kitchables. To get 75% of my order great, that’s unfortunate

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality - Be sure it will work for you.
customer_reviews.text: These are well made espresso glasses. The quality is very good. They are vacuum sealed so are well insulated. My only problem is that they aren't quite large enough for the Nespresso Double Espresso. I think the glasses are exactly 2.7 oz and the typical Double Espresso is 2.7 oz PLUS a bit of crema, so these overflow sometimes with the Double. They're fine for a single espresso. I'm also not a huge fan of the rounded shape. While they look great, I always feel like they're going to slip out of my hand when I wash or dry them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Cantor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Design and Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Well crafted. These cups have a beautiful, modern look, and they feel great in your hands. The insulation is no joke either. I needed some additional espresso cups for when I make my morning mochas, and these work great. No burning fingers here! The packaging gave a great first impression with a handwritten card and a coaster that I was not expecting. I only see room for improvement in two ways: 1) Fill lines for single and double shot. 2) Better flow features for transferring from one of these to a mug. I still give this review 5 stars because these cups are intended for those who drink straight espresso, and they still perform quite well when making espresso-based drinks.

I dropped the espresso cup on my kitchen tile and it shattered in so many tiny pieces that I spent 20 minutes vacuuming for one tiny glass. The pieces were everywhere--in the carpet, stuck between wood, and in tiny crevices--posing danger to my child. I'm very disappointed at the false claim made.

customer_reviews.text: Bought them to use with Breville Barista. Although they look good and do their job (the exterior does not get hot), I have to manually raise them close to the extractors while the machine pours out the espresso. If I put them together below the extractors the espresso will pour out of the cups because the height of the extractors will make the drip go down vertically and the cups construction does not work with this particular pour and their mouth is not wide enough to use one cup instead of two.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied all around :)

I love the thickness of the double walls (not the thickness of the glass, but the space between the two layers) and how the cups curve inwards. Feels great in your hands! I enjoy using these for serving higher-quality green/Jasmine/herbal teas etc., and for having miniature servings of ice cream, haha. The order also came with a handwritten thank-you note from the owner, a scratch-off discount code, and a cork coaster ^_^ Don't want to slam these down onto a glass table!
